content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the original and simplified passages

The passage:
To solve the formulated problem, a Block Successive Majorization-Minimization (BS-MM) technique is applied.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The passage uses specialized terminology, such as "Block Successive Majorization-Minimization (BS-MM)," which may be challenging for a university student to understand without prior knowledge. Therefore, the complexity level is above the desired complexity (DC) of a university student.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The complicated section of the passage is "Block Successive Majorization-Minimization (BS-MM) technique."
Simplify this section
The simplified section is "a method called BS-MM."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
The updated passage is: "To solve the formulated problem, a method called BS-MM is applied."
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

The information loss in the updated passage is that the original term "Block Successive Majorization-Minimization" is replaced with the simplified term "a method called BS-MM." The severity of this information loss is moderate because while the acronym (BS-MM) is still presented, the full description is omitted. Readers unfamiliar with the acronym may not fully understand what the method entails. 

Since the information loss is classified as moderate, it is within the acceptable limit of information loss tolerance (ILT). Therefore, the changes can be accepted, and the updated passage remains valid.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
If needed, adjust the passage to maintain readabily and flow of text

The passage is already clear and flows well after the simplification. Therefore, no further adjustments are needed. 

The final simplified passage is: "To solve the formulated problem, a method called BS-MM is applied."
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage is appropriate for a university student. It uses simpler language and explains the technique (BS-MM) without the more complex terminology, making it easier to understand.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Provide the final version of the simplified passage
The final version of the simplified passage is: "To solve the formulated problem, a method called BS-MM is applied."
